data.text: @macroliter I don’t trust the Chinese information/data that was used. Still plausible that it was natural, brought to lab for study, and accidental leak.

@macroliter Like wow you took 100 discrete data points and interpolated them into a density gradient at a resolution much more granular than the actual sampling and forgot to account for the sampling density I’m so impressed

@macroliter I think the only reason anyone may appear to be losing anything is because they are losing patience with bad science... and bad scientists. 
https://t.co/SF8cPfhtrr
@macroliter Come on! Where is animal zero and the animals that were around it?

@Onychomys2 💯… it is so telling the people who have been insisting not enough is being done to “investigate the origins” of COVID-19 turn around and reject any results of effing stellar investigations that don’t happen to match the Grand Lab Leak Inquisitor’s preordained conclusions.

@macroliter The only answer is to allege mistakes or fraud in the data... if it's fraud it would've saved a lot of headaches to do the fraud 2 years ago, or maybe that's just what they want you think!
@macroliter Seems like there are only 2-3 propagandi...ahem, "scientists" left who will defend wet market theory.  Can't they find someone besides you to carry all their water?

@macroliter I'm honestly not sure what would satisfy them at this point. Even if we had a youtube video where a raccoon dog (etc) was sneezing directly into the face of a vendor at the market, they'd demand a CSI-level "enhance video" montage so we could see virions in flight.
